result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Michael D. Alexander

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall contact the Clerk's office upon release from custody to set up a payment plan.

The jail sentence may be served with good time.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Concurrent with: Taylor County Case Nos. 15CF71 and 14CF54

The State agrees to dismiss and read-in an uncharged case of intimidation of a witness and the corresponding felony bail jumping and also an uncharged conspiracy to deliver meth which occurred between 2013 and September of 2015.

records.addlTxt: In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant Michael D. Alexander in court with attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz.  Defendant Michael D. Alexander in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Count 3 and Count 4 in Case No. 15CF71 and Count 2 in Case No. 15CF61.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty in Counts 1, 3 and 4 in Case No. 15CF71 and Count 2 in Case No. 15CF61.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining charges in 15CF71 and 15CF61.  Statements by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Jarmuz.  Court orders in 15CF71 - Count 1 - 14 year prison sentence consisting of 6 years initial confinement and 8 years extended supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision - court costs, DNA sample and surcharge and counseling as deemed appropriate. Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program but not Challenge Incarceration program.  Court orders 261 days sentence credit.  Counts 3 and 4 are straight sentence of court costs.  Case No. 15CF61 - court orders court costs and six months county jail concurrent to 15CF71 and 14CF54.  Court also ordered that the clerk enter on the JOC that the State agrees to dismiss and read in uncharged case of intimidation of a witness and corresponding felony bail jumping and uncharged conspiracy to deliver meth which occurred between 2013 and September of 2015.  - rt
Plea hearing on June 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
and Order for Adjournment
of Motion Hearing held on March 10, 2016 - Lisa M. Weber, RMR, CRR

Court denies request as he is on a hold through the Department of Corrections.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 11:00 am. - rt
